reviewText:
6min of gameplay
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n9WBNeHLYmM

Cute game nothing fantastic but there are only a few mini-gulf games on steam right now.
There are 4 characters with 2 outfits in 2 colors each to pick from that all play the same.
You can also change the ball color too if you want to spice things up a bit.
The courses have themes like wild west, Inca(or Mayan) temple, space, amusement park, and a few others.
Most have more than one way to complete them with off & hidden paths that make it easier to get a hole in one.
There will be power-up in most levels like jump, fire, glue, bomb and a few more but most don't seem to help much.
2-4 player mode is only allowed on the same system but there is no timer so you're not rushed swapping people.
The editor is vary basic and just lets you build on a 4x4 grid and you can't use any of the themed stuff.

Overall its not bad the themes are interesting and feel very different from each other.
Looking for the best way through some levels add replay ability.
It won't blow you away but it's a good mini gulf game.

reviewText:
The graphics are okay and the hole designs are creative but the gameplay leaves something to be desired.

Carefully planning and crafting an approach to each hole followed by watching your perfectly executed shot drop delicately into the cup is the magic in mini-golf. This game lacks that appeal for several reasons. The controls are limited (you only control direction and power) as there is no ability to put backspin on the ball or angle the ball off of your club. The physics are cartoonish leading to frustrating moments where reality does not align with your plan. Additionally, certain objects and boundaries/walls within the holes themselves are not modeled very well and can never be trusted to bounce where one would expect (imagine running in an action-oriented game in a wide-open field then being halted by an invisible wall).

Edit: Realized this game was made in 2006. My expectations are lowered but the comments above are still applicable today.

reviewText: Looking for something completely insane and totally useless. This is the game for you. Four courses of unbelievable mini golf impossibility, four crazy characters, power-ups, obstacles, tournaments and a course editor. 3d Ultra have made some interesting games out of simple ideas and this is another of those. May not have the longevity of games like Killing Floor, but will leave you a zombie none-the-less and the kids will enjoy it.

reviewText: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. I agreed. At 28
date: I have never touched a cigarette. I must say
recommended: I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it
hoursPlayed: because this game gave me cancer anyway."

reviewText: One look at the title should be enough to evaluate the quality of this game. It's every bit as bargain bin as it sounds. It's a passable attempt at minigolf if you're looking for a game that looks and feels like it belongs on the playstation circa 1996. Sadly, for all its attempts to sound cool with its 3D" and its "ultra" it's actually pretty boring and pretty tame. It's very dated now but even by the standards of 15 years ago it would have been below average at best. Don't waste your money."

reviewText:
Not bad, not great.

I've had this sitting in my library for around 8 months now I believe. When I initially bought it, I had quite a lot of fun messing around with friends and as a whole wasn't so bad, but there are definitely improvements that need to be made. The graphics are meh, and it is quite glitchy on certain maps, too. It gets very repetetive after awhile, and hasn't been played in over 3-4 months I imagine, and if I have played it since, it wouldn't have been for very long. On the other hand, the first 3 months of the purchase I found was very pleasant, and of course makes it better when you do it with friends etc.

I've decided to not recommend this game, as the point of a game isn't to just be played for a couple of months and instantly abandon it, much like I did in this case.

5/10 - Big room for improvement, but not the worst game of all time.
